image.altText: A man with a white beard and hair wearing a black suit smiling.

props.synopsis: Former Australian National University chancellor, Gareth Evans, says proposed cost-saving cuts to the institution have "ignored or gravely under-valued the significance of ANU's very distinctive national mission".

title.children: Former ANU chancellor says proposed uni cuts 'gobsmacking'

image.altText: dark clouds hover over Iluka Break Wall on beach street at iluka at new south wales

props.synopsis: The wait for significant drought relief is finally over, and for once the best falls will reach all the right places.

title.children: Heaviest rain and snow in years ahead for southern Australia

image.altText: Skiers stand next to a sign in the snow.

props.synopsis: Visits to Aussie ski resorts dropped by nearly 30 per cent since the pandemic with the expense putting it out of reach for many. But here's some tips on how to do it without breaking the bank.

title.children: Is skiing overseas really cheaper? The Japan vs Aussie alps showdown

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff dressed in court robes walks down a street. in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Walter Sofronoff's appeal against the ACT Integrity Commission's findings that he engaged in "serious corrupt conduct" has heard his actions were not "dishonest or malicious".¬†

title.children: Sofronoff may have been wrong but 'not corrupt', lawyers argue

image.altText: Three volunteers hand out assistance at a help desk.

props.synopsis: The ACT government scraps a plan to begin charging volunteers $11 to register for a Working with Vulnerable People card following backlash from community groups, the opposition and the crossbench.

title.children: ACT government backs down on second budget measure

image.altText: Charlotte Walker and Mark Butler at a Labor campaign ev

props.synopsis: The new session of federal parliament is one of the youngest and most diverse ever. What is it like being a younger person in the corridors of power?

title.children: What it's like being the youngest person in parliament

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A road rage incident in which a Canberra man was stabbed last year has landed his attacker with a jail sentence of more than three years, with the judge noting his motives for the attack were trivial and that he seemed to boast about the incident afterwards.

title.children: 'Brazen act of extreme violence': Man jailed over road rage stabbing

image.altText: A rescue boat speeds across a choppy sea.

props.synopsis: The search area for the 56-year-old, who went missing after leaving Batemans Bay on Saturday, has been expanded following unconfirmed sightings of his vessel.

title.children: Search for missing fisher expanded to cover half of NSW coastline

image.altText: A brightly coloured fire truck

props.synopsis: This hybrid electric fire truck was celebrated on arrival but questions remain over its value for money.¬†

title.children: Issue-plagued $1.6 million hybrid electric fire truck off the road again

image.altText: Penny Wong sitting at a table at a diplomatic summit.

props.synopsis: A joint statement signed by Penny Wong and foreign ministers from the UK, France, Canada and others says Israel's aid delivery model is "dangerous, fuels instability and deprives Gazans of human dignity".

title.children: Australia among 28 nations calling for immediate end to war in Gaza

image.altText: albanese

props.synopsis: Politicians new and old return to Canberra for the first sitting day of the new term of parliament. Follow live.

title.children: MPs attend church ahead of parliament's return

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Politicians gather for church ahead of the new parliamentary term

Will Labor use its new majority to make changes to taxes?

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: The man who spearheaded negotiations on a global minimum tax rate says Australia could miss out on significant revenue from US multinational companies after the G7 "caved" to Donald Trump.

title.children: Australia to lose revenue as Trump tax backdown 'protects American companies'

image.altText: Malcolm-Jamal Warner smiling while wearing a black high-neck jacket with a golden pattern around the collar

props.synopsis: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, the actor who played teenage son Theo Huxtable on The Cosby Show, has died at age 54 in an accidental drowning incident at a beach in Costa Rica.

title.children: The Cosby Show star dies at 54 in accidental drowning

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: Dozens of aged care residents are dying of COVID each week as facilities grapple with more than 240 outbreaks nationwide.

title.children: Hundreds of aged care facilities battle COVID outbreaks across Australia

image.altText: Sussan Ley stands and gestures as she speaks to a room of people.

props.synopsis: As parliament returns, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley and other senior Liberals may have to leave the first sitting day early to attend a party fundraiser sponsored by global beer giant Lion.

title.children: Liberals could slip out early from first sitting day to attend party fundraiser

image.altText: Tadej Pogaƒçar rides up a mountain in the yellow jersey

props.synopsis: The ascent to hell on the punishing slopes of Mont Ventoux is one of the Tour de France's most formidable and iconic theatres and has a history dotted with drama and tragedy.

title.children: The 'accursed' mountain that stands apart this Tour de France

image.altText: A man sitting in front of a computer at a work office.

props.synopsis: A new peer-reviewed study finds a four-day work week improves both physical and mental health, reduces burnout and boosts job satisfaction. It's led some experts to say the federal government's productivity round table in August could help reframe work from being focused on hours to outcomes.

title.children: Working a four-day week without taking a pay cut reduces burnout

image.altText: dark clouds hover over Iluka Break Wall on beach street at iluka at new south wales

props.synopsis: The wait for significant drought relief is finally over, and for once the best falls will reach all the right places.

title.children: Heaviest rain and snow in years ahead for southern Australia

image.altText: A picture of Mark Latham on a wall

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese won't remove a caucus portrait of Mark Latham but says he regrets him ever being Labor Party leader.

title.children: 'Range of repulsive views': Albanese speaks out against Latham

image.altText: People in various uniforms cluster around a damaged, burnt building.

props.synopsis: A Chinese-made aircraft experienced a "technical malfunction" moments after take-off, and its pilot attempted to divert the plane to a less-populated area before crashing, the nation's military says.

title.children: At least 19 people killed as Bangladesh Air Force plane crashes into school

image.altText: About 15 people dance around in a field set up with bunting and tables and chairs, dressed in 1800s clothing.

props.synopsis: New series sees three families swap their 21st century lives for an 1880s-style homestead and compete to prove they can survive off the land over an entire summer. Plus, four more shows to watch this month.

title.children: Three families forced to live like it's the 1880s in new reality show

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a blue and yellow shirt waits to see a doctor in a clinic

props.synopsis: First Nations people living in the remote Northern Territory are still not expected to reach their 70th birthday. A rare visit inside one of the NT's oldest bush clinics demonstrates why.¬†

title.children: The unlikely killers near Australia's most dangerous river crossing

image.altText: Three tenst under a tree in a park.

props.synopsis: Homelessness has risen to the "worst levels in living memory" in the first term of the Albanese government, advocacy groups warn, as the government grapples with advice that housing targets will not be met.

title.children: Women 'stuck' in refuges as housing crisis fuels worst homelessness 'in living memory'

image.altText: David Bartlett in ABC Radio Hobart studio.

props.synopsis: David Bartlett, who governed in minority under an agreement with the Greens, says the arrangement can work if cool heads prevail and no-one rushes to "explode the whole government".

title.children: Ex-Tasmania premier says his time showed minority government can work

image.altText: A female with brown hair looks down at a wire with a branch wrapped around it.

props.synopsis: Ballooning water prices in Australia's largest wine grape growing region are pushing farmers to the brink amid a global oversupply of some wines and ongoing drought in southern Australia.

title.children: 'We're at breaking point': Drought and soaring water prices push wine grape growers to exit

image.altText: A drone photo taken from above a beach wall at Frankston South

props.synopsis: As sea level rises threaten coastal infrastructure, erosion is becoming a growing threat for communities across Australia.

title.children: Erosion is threatening Australia's coastline. Who decides how to stop it?

image.altText: Photos of an e-bike, some delivery food e-bikes, in the Parramatta CBD on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Fines for e-bike suppliers and manufacturers of up to $825,000 were meant to kick start from August 1, in a state government effort to curb lithium-ion battery fires and fatalities.

title.children: The NSW e-bike changes that saw retailers rapidly clear stock delayed

image.altText: Man with black hair holding football, leaning over a white picket fence.

props.synopsis: Jeremy Rodi would forget how he spent the day before seeking treatment for concussion. Now a treatment clinic has opened in his home town of Bendigo in regional Victoria.

title.children: Country footballers desperate for concussion treatment book out clinic

image.altText: A dam in a Tibetan mountain valley.

props.synopsis: The Indian and Bangladeshi governments fear the project could have major impacts on millions of people living downstream.

title.children: 'Project of the century': China starts building world's biggest hydro-electric dam

image.altText: Dead fish laying on the seabed surrounded by green waters

props.synopsis: The federal government has pledged $14 million to assist South Australia as it continues to deal with a toxic algal bloom outbreak, but has stopped short of declaring it a national disaster.¬†

title.children: 'I've got fishermen in tears on the phone': $14m in federal funding as fishers count the cost

image.altText: Jasmin Fawcett Clarke and Thorn 2025-07-09 10:07:00

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has announced the state's largest ever investment in special schools, with a "clear demand for the schools".

title.children: Jasmin says she felt pressured to enrol her son at a special school

image.altText: CCTV footage of a store alight

props.synopsis: In the midst of the tobacco wars, Victoria Police asked the government to make it harder for accused arsonists to get bail, but its requests were mostly refused, secret documents show.

title.children: Police want bail crackdown on tobacco arsonists, FOI documents show

image.altText: A smiling blonde girl in a pink crop top holds up a blue cowboys dance uniform

props.synopsis: The 22-year-old is the first New Zealander and third Australian to make the prestigious team for the world-famous NFL franchise.

title.children: Perth dancer makes Dallas Cowboys cheerleading team after 'cutthroat' process
